meanings.definition: A cause of distress or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The upcoming exam was an incubuses for the students.
meanings.sent2: Financial troubles can be a common incubuses for many people.
meanings.sent3: The thought of spiders was an unexpected incubuses for the brave knight.
meanings.sent4: Fear of failure can sometimes feel like a heavy incubuses on one's shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds looming overhead were a looming incubuses of the storm to come.

meanings.definition: A demon or evil spirit believed to lie on sleeping persons.
meanings.sent1: In some folklore, an incubuses is said to cause nightmares to those it visits.
meanings.sent2: The old tales speak of how to ward off an incubuses during the night.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous ghost was jokingly called an incubuses by the villagers.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of dread in the haunted house was like having an incubuses watching over you.
meanings.sent5: The legend tells of an incubuses that feeds on the fear of the sleeping.
